scenario_text.value: Where...am I?!

(I feel strangely unsteady on my feet. It’s
like I’m on some sort of air cushion.)
Takuma...!
Hurray! You’re all right!

Minoru! Agumon! And...everyone... What is
this place?!
Looks like it’s time for our final exam.

But things did take an unexpected turn. You
hear that?
Hm?
Is that...Aoi and the Master fighting?

You are a threat... Urgh... Yet you too are
to become my prey!

Gah... I don’t think so! I am going to make
this happen!

I am going to build an ideal world, and
you’re not going to stop me! Yeeaaah!!!
Never!!!
Oh no! Gah... Ah... Urgh...
Oh no! Aoi!
No... No! I can’t fail now!

I still...haven’t gotten...to apologize...
Takuma...everyone...I’m sor—
Ah... Yes... Very good...
So, Aoi just got...taken in?
Oh no... What are we going to do now?

The only thing we can do. We take on the
Master and settle this once and for all.

But now that we’ve lost Miyuki, and even
Aoi’s been taken in, what chance do we have?
Shouldn’t we consider making a retreat?

We don’t need to retreat, but we should at
least regroup for now!
(What now? What do we do?!)

(Kaito’s probably right. Now that we’ve come
this far, we have to fight.)

(But the Master must be unimaginably strong
right now.)

(So maybe we should listen to the professor
and retreat.)

(Or at least pull back so we can regroup like
Minoru said.)
(What should we do?)
We should fight.
We should run.
We should regroup.
We should fight.

Kaito’s right. Now that we’ve come this far,
backing out isn’t an option.

Yeah, and even if we did run, we’d still have
to face the Master at some point.
So we might as well take him on here and now.

Fortunately, he hasn’t noticed us yet. This
may be the best chance we ever get.

Yeah...but it’s not just that. I...want to
get him back for what he did to Aoi.

Right at the end, she...she apologized to
us...

Even...even after she turned into Plutomon,
Aoi was still in there!
I’m sure of it!

Yeah! So let’s go make the Master pay for
what he did to Miyuki and Aoi!

This is all turning out to be a lot worse
than we first thought.
We should run.

Maybe the professor’s right. Maybe we should
run...

But if we run now, who knows what’ll happen
to us, or to our world?!

Yeah! And if we wait until after the Master’s
messed everything up, it’ll be too late!

B-but...we know he’s taken in Miyuki, and we
saw him take in Aoi in the form of Plutomon.

Don’t you think it’s reckless to fight the
Master after he just got unimaginably strong?
Then when are we supposed to fight him?!
I...I don’t know...

Takuma, it’s now or never! If we run away
now, that’s all we’ll ever do.
We’ve got to stand and fight!
Listen, Takuma... I’m...going to fight too.
Are you sure, Miu?!

Because if I don’t...I feel like I’d be
letting Aoi down!

Right at the end, she... She said she was
sorry... So...

Yes, I see. You can’t bring yourself to leave
here without finishing what she started.

(That’s right... Aoi may have been misguided
in what she did, but she did it for us.)
(She fought against the Master and lost.)

(Having witnessed that, do we just turn tail
and run? No, that would be cowardice!)

I’m sorry, everyone. You’re right, we can’t
run now.

We need to fight. Let’s go make the Master
pay for what he did to Miyuki and Aoi!
We should regroup.

I...I honestly have no idea what we should
do, so...why don’t we pull back and regroup?
You think we’ve got time for that?

But if we rush in to fight now, we may not
even stand a chance.

How is that going to change by us pulling
back and then preparing to go back in?
Uh... Well, now that you put it that way...
Actually, I think now’s our best shot.

I don’t know what our chances are, but if we
act now, we could get Aoi and Miyuki back.

And even if that doesn’t work, we should beat
him before he masters Plutomon’s power.

You mean...you don’t think he’s gotten full
control of Plutomon’s power yet?

It’s just a hunch, but I think it’s a real
possibility.

Anyway, all that’s besides the point. What
really matters is...

...we need to make the Master pay for what he
did to Aoi and Miyuki!

Yeah...you’re right. Ultimately, we couldn’t
save either one of them.
So the least we can do is avenge them...

After all, despite everything that happened,
Aoi was one of us, right to the end.

If she hadn’t been, the last thing she said
wouldn’t have been an apology.
So we need to make the Master pay!
Yeah, let’s do it!

The Master doesn’t seem to have noticed us
yet. We should take advantage of that and—
T-T-T-Takuma!!!
I smell...humans...
Uwaaah!!!
Ah, there you are! Pathetic little intruders!
(Crap! I yelled before I could stop myself!)
How perfect! You too will fall!!!
He’s onto us! We have to fight now!
